quest.name: An Express Delivery
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Hargra needs something delivered to her brother with all haste.
objectives: Deliver the well-worn journal to the red-haired Hume.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: Please, misssir, can you help me?

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: My brother recently left to the Crystarium, but he forgot his journal. He would be devastated to know he left it behind.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: If you hurry, you can likely find him before he reaches Lakeland.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: He's rather tall and has red hair, so he should be easy to spot. Please go and deliver it to him, I beg of you.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: That journal means the world to him. He must have it.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: Yes? ...Something from my sister?

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: By the abyss, my journal! Thank you, misssir. Thank you so much.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: I thought I should pay one last visit to what remains of our old home and offer a prayer to our parents. And it's a good thing I did, it seems.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: If I may, I'd like to ask you a question.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: I can only assume you've been to all sorts of places, and seen incredible things in your travels.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: But do you ever get tired of being constantly on the move? Do you ever yearn to return home?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: At times, yes.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Can't say that I have.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: And yet here you are. I could only hope to have such conviction.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: I see. Truly, you are a womanman of great conviction to stay so focused on the tasks before you.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: I can learn much from your example. All the more reason I should get going to the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: BROTHER03455
dialogue.text: Thanks again for the journal. Tell my sister I said thank you, as well.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: Were you able to find him? Is he doing all right?

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: Thank goodness.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: After Master Matoya arrived, and began helping us piece our lives back together, he was constantly at her side learning all he could of the world outside the Greatwood. Everything he learned is written in that journal.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: His dream is to become a craftsman to someday help rebuild Fort Gohn.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: It pains me to see him leave, and I know it was hard for him too.

dialogue.name: HARGRA
dialogue.text: But in the end, we both know it will be for the best.
